all and all , it ' s a light weight , but very robust development stack , that also has the added convenience of cloud9 ' s collaboration features wherein multiple developers can be writing code in even the same file simultaneously .
thus far , i ' ve loaded a number of games , my password vault , several productivity apps , skype , spotify and some network scanning android apps and they ' ve all worked very well .
mouse and trackpad settings are very minimalist , there ' s no way to modify short - cut keys , and the power management options are pretty minimal , too .
and the google play store is chock - full of great apps and games .
it ' s really seamless and smooth to move back and forth and makes experimenting with different linux configs and environments effortless .
you won ' t be disappointed with this great little machine how ever you end up using it , and that versatility is what really makes this machine such a fun and valuable computer .
for ~ $ 15 you can get a nice , fitted anti - glare screen protector that reduces the fingerprint / glare problems and gives you some piece of mind about protecting that gorgeous screen .
i saw this c302 was announced at ces and was immediately drawn to it since it has the intel core m3 processor .
apps like microsoft word , excel , etc run wonderfully .
for instance , the android youtube app doesn ' t work well at all because it ' s very inconvenient to get videos into full - screen mode .
it seems pretty fast .
so i ' m very happy and relieved to see it working excellently on the c302 .
this is easily the best overall chromebook out there right now ( under $ 500 ) .
* battery * - battery life is great .
the backlight works great and i had no problems using it in the dark .
it ' s a nice smooth surface so no tension when gliding across it .
multi - touch input works great .
* build quality * - i ' m really pleased with the overall quality .
it ' s light enough to carry pretty much every where .
it starts up , runs without issues .
even the speakers are way better than i expected from a 2 in 1 at this price point .
this is finally the chromebook i ' ve been waiting for , that is not a $ 1300 pixel .
- the screen has great contrast and is glossy and sharp
- this may be a personal preference but i did wish the screen was a tad bit brighter .
overall great chromebook .
this is a spectacular chromebook .
it ' s faster , the screen is much nicer , and it has twice the memory and four times the drive space .
the core m3 processor allows the c302 to be fanless , as well , adding to the sleek design .
it ' s a real timesaver , honestly .
i find the display sharp and touch responsive to be quite excellent .
at the end of the day i think it is worth the extra cost if you are looking for a premium product feel .
- nice , bright screen ( touchscreen , too ! )
battery doesn ' t last nearly as long as advertised .
this is a very cleverly designed and fast machine .
operational speed - - likely the fastest laptop i have ever used ( for basic functions ) .
edit 2 : 8 months in and everything is working great .
- trackpad isn ' t the best .
- the touch screen isn ' t as accurate as i wish , for cases like tapping tiny things around the edges .
- the screen size is an awkward 16 : 9 and provides a 1920x1080 resolution ( although the default is set to 1536x864 ) .
for 99 % of the people looking at chromebooks right now for personal use , this asus is probably the best choice in the market .
overall , i am extremely impressed with this chromebook and would highly recommend this to others .
it works well as a tablet .
it works great as a laptop and for the things i do which tend to be web based .
nevertheless , i did have my own nitpicking issues with it but for the $ 250 price tag it launched with , it was well worth it .
i found the display to be very vibrant , with excellent pixel density .
i like the dispersion of ports and feel it helps with the ergonomics of your daily usage .
still , for $ 450 i ' m a huge fan of the screen and the excellent overall build quality .
and even with all of the new competition hitting the market with higher price points , the c302 still offers the best premium chrome os experience at a respectable price .
